resources.string: No networks with both frequencies and same SSID found!
Location services need to be enabled!
Wifi already connected with preferred frequency
Please try to configure 5 GHz network with current SSIDâ€¦
Forces Wifi to switch to 5 GHz channels
Minimum signal level to switch over
Activate or de-activate the functionality to switch automatically the frequency of your Wifi
Choose your preferred frequency - either 2.4 GHz or 5 GHz if supported
Define the minimum signal level to switch over to another frequency. This avoids switching to a weaker network.
Found the following Wifi access points with same SSID and 2.4/5 GHz - trying to switch to preferred one.
You don\'t have any Wifi access points with both 2.4 and 5 GHz band on same SSID nearby. Please find another Wifi access point with multiple frequencies on the same SSID to make use of this app.
Found the following Wifi access points with same SSID and 2.4/5 GHz - trying to switch to preferred one. Please note: Starting with Android 10 you probably need to re-connect your Wifi manually!
Choose another network (SSID) with the desired frequency instead of staying with the same SSID
Please re-connect to your Wifi manually to change frequency

I wrote this app to force my devices to the less used 5 GHz channels of my Wifi network.

Trying with several devices, Android versions and a lot of research, I found out that Google does not provide a stable API to switch Wifi networks by an app (due to security reasons).


Therefore this app MAY or MAY NOT work on your device. So, please give a try. If it\'s not working, don\'t complain, just de-install it.


Any feedback is welcome at: erichambuch@googlemail.com.
